meanings.definition: The state or quality of being excessively irritable.
meanings.sent1: Her hyperirritabilities made it challenging to work with her.
meanings.sent2: His hyperirritabilities often caused misunderstandings with his friends.
meanings.sent3: When his hyperirritabilities kick in, he becomes a grumpy bear.
meanings.sent4: The hyperirritabilities in the room were palpable, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritabilities of the toddler were like a storm brewing, ready to explode at any moment.

meanings.definition: The tendency to react strongly or excessively to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The child's hyperirritabilities led to frequent outbursts in class.
meanings.sent2: Some people have hyperirritabilities that make them more sensitive to noise.
meanings.sent3: His hyperirritabilities were so extreme that even a gentle touch would startle him.
meanings.sent4: The hyperirritabilities of the alarm system made it go off at the slightest movement.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritabilities of the dog made it bark at every passing car.
